snippet: Law enforcement officials in Greece, N.Y., say they are close to seeking an indictment in connection with a 1978 blaze at a Holiday Inn that killed 10.
abstract: Fire that destroyed Holiday Inn motel and killed 10 people in Greece, NY, in 1978 is still under investigation; prime suspect Harold J Phillips was first firefighter at scene and is now town's fire chief; investigation was revived in 2010 by then police chief Todd Baxter, who set up task force and brought in outside investigators; current police chief Patrick Phelan hopes to bring case to DA's office soon.
lead_paragraph: Law enforcement officials in Greece, N.Y., say they are close to seeking an indictment in connection with a 1978 blaze at a Holiday Inn that killed 10.

headline.main: After 36 Years, a New York Town Sifts Through Suspicions on a Fatal Fire
headline.print_headline: After 36 Years, Town Sifts Through Its Suspicions on a Fatal Fire
